Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that National Guard troops have been forced to contact food banks to feed themselves.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that National Guard troops have not been paid for weeks, leading them to seek food assistance. However, this assumption is not clearly supported or verified.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by Texas Army National Guard Brig. Gen. Patrick Hamilton, who stated that no troops had visited the food bank to his knowledge. This suggests that there may be an alternative explanation for the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times due to conflicting statements and uncertain information regarding the number of soldiers who have used the food bank or sought assistance.
Understate: The claim may potentially understate the situation by implying that all National Guard troops have been forced to contact food banks, when it is unclear how many soldiers have actually sought assistance.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the statement from Texas Army National Guard Brig. Gen. Patrick Hamilton, who stated that no troops had visited the food bank to his knowledge.
